item.title: Reactive Programming, Rxjava and Vert.x
item.description: Reactive Programming Reactive programming is programming with asynchronous data streams. When using reactive programming, data streams are going to be the spine of your application. Events, messages, calls, and even failures are going to be conveyed by a data stream. With reactive programming, you observe these streams and react when a value is emitted. Rxjava Reactive eXtension (http://reactivex.io, aka. RX) is an implementation of the reactive programming principles to “compose asynchronous and event-based programs by using observable sequence”.
